meanings.definition: Used to indicate duty or obligation.
meanings.sent1: She oughted to finish her homework before watching TV.
meanings.sent2: He always oughted to help his elderly neighbor with groceries.
meanings.sent3: The cat oughted to clean its own fur for once.
meanings.sent4: The sun oughted to rise every morning without fail.
meanings.sent5: The students oughted to study hard for their exams to succeed.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate a likelihood or probability.
meanings.sent1: It oughted to rain later in the day.
meanings.sent2: The bus oughted to arrive at the stop any minute now.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter oughted to rise in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The stars oughted to twinkle brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The flowers oughted to bloom beautifully in the spring.
